important:
Für die Teilnahme an einem Bachatakurs ist ein Tanzpartner Voraussetzung. Die
Teilnahme mit einem gleichgeschlechtlichen Tanzpartner ist möglich. Es werden
keine Tanzpartner/innen seitens Universitätssport organisiert. Beide
Tanzpartner müssen sich mit dem Online-Anmeldeformular für den Bachatakurs einschreiben.
Bitte unter Bemerkungen den Namen des Tanzpartners/der Tanzpartnerin vermerken.
Immatrikulierte Studierende und Mitarbeitende der Universität und PH Bern
können für einen Tanzpartner der nicht an der Universität studiert oder
arbeitet einen Lebenspartner-Unisportausweis kaufen.
description:
In this course the basic knowledge of bachata is taught: feel, lead and lead rhythm, isolation exercises and Pasitos, various basic steps, single rotations Man and woman and various basic figures.
The lessons are arranged in such a way that also dances with different dance partners.
requirements: No Bachatakenntnisse are provided.
registration: No longer possible to log in
price: Studierende Uni und PH: CHF 40.00 / Angestellte Uni und PH: CHF 40.00 / Übrige Ausweisbesitzende: CHF 40.00
material: Comfortable clothes, clean dance shoes (no shoes with pencil heel!)

important: Für die Teilnahme an einem Bachatakurs ist ein Tanzpartner Voraussetzung. Die Teilnahme mit einem gleichgeschlechtlichen Tanzpartner ist möglich. Es werden keine Tanzpartner/innen seitens Universitätssport organisiert. Beide Tanzpartner müssen sich mit dem Online-Anmeldeformular für den Bachatakurs einschreiben. Bitte unter Bemerkungen den Namen des Tanzpartners/der Tanzpartnerin vermerken. Immatrikulierte Studierende und Mitarbeitende der Universität und PH Bern können für einen Tanzpartner der nicht an der Universität studiert oder arbeitet einen Lebenspartner-Unisportausweis kaufen.
description:
In this course, mainly more advanced and more complex figures are taught on the basis of the basic figures of bachata. In addition, there is a focus on dancing «to music». Continuation of isolation exercises, deepening of body rolls and Pasitos.
The lessons are arranged in such a way that also dances with different dance partners.
requirements: Participation in a L1 course requires a visit to a Unisport Bachatabasiskurses or an equivalent training at a dance school. Mastery of the basic elements is a must. If the course executives find that a couple is not up to the requirements of the L1 course, the couple can be excluded from the course.
price: Studierende Uni und PH: CHF 40.00 / Angestellte Uni und PH: CHF 40.00 / Übrige Ausweisbesitzende: CHF 40.00
material: Comfortable clothes, clean dance shoes (no shoes with pencil heel!)

description:
The best badminton students compete in singles (men's singles, women's singles) and doubles (men's doubles, ladies doubles). The results have no influence on the personal ranking of Swiss badminton. A title win "Swiss College champion Badminton" is on the one hand prestige, on the other hand he can promise to participate in the European Championships. However, a strong uni-Bern overall performance is essential.
Game/Zeitplan: Will be announced a few days before the tournament. Rules: Official Rules of Swiss badminton Referee: It is played without referee.

Catering: The organiser offers lunch meals.
requirements:
Fortgeschrittene  (lizenzierte) Badmintonspieler/innen. Alle Spieler/innen sind an einer anerkannten Schweizer Hochschule oder als 
Schweizer Bürger an einer entsprechenden ausländischen Hochschule 
immatrikuliert oder haben das Studium seit höchstens 1 Jahr abgeschlossen 
oder unterbrochen.
material: Own badminton racket, official spring shuttles. A tube shuttle provides the Bernese students with free access to the Unisport Bern.

important: Es kann Doppel und Einzel gespielt werden. Bitte bei der Anmeldung Folgendes angeben: Leistungsniveau, gewünschte Disziplinen, gegebenenfalls Doppelpartner/in.
description:
Provisional timetable: 18.00 pm: Presence control; Warm up, play 18.40 pm: Welcome, Information 18.45 am: Start of the game (group games in different strength classes) no later than 03.00 am: Tournament closing disciplines: Women singles, men singles, doubles. In the individual disciplines there are different game strength categories. For doubles, mixed and same-sex pairs may be formed (1 open category), but a maximum of one player may be licensed.

Rules: The rules of the game are slightly modified (sentence, etc.). In general, however, the official rules of Swiss badminton apply.

Shuttles: It is usually played with plastic shuttles, which the organizer puts.

Referee: It is played without referee.

Catering: A small buffet with cakes, plaits, fruits etc. is organized.
requirements: All players must have a Unicard or a unisport card.
registration: No longer possible to log in
material:
Own racket, clean halls sneakers (no jogging shoes!), sportswear.

The shuttles are provided by the University sports. Some rackets are available for rent (against delivery of the Unicard).

description: "Barre à terre" is a full-body training where dance movements and strength training flow together. The muscle structures are lengthened, strengthened and corrected in the correct position by ballet-specific exercises on the ground. The training helps to have a good flexibility of your own body. "Barre à terre" is suitable for every level and not just for ballet dancers. The offer is an ideal complement to many dance trainings.
requirements: In the first three semester weeks of the autumn and spring semester, a non-binding sniff (with valid Unisport ID or UNICARD) is possible. After that, a complete participation is desired.
material: Comfortable sportswear (jersey, pantyhose/leggings), ballet shoes or socks

description:
After a sequence with warm-up exercises (mobilize joints and stimulate circulation), targeted strengthening exercises with or without AIDS follow.
Our objective is to improve posture and movement through targeted exercises for skeleton and musculature with own body weight, rubber band, dumbbells etc. Each training session is rounded off with a mobility training (e.g. stretching).

description:
bouldering, bouldering, bouldering! Fontainebleau is a land of paradise on the skirts of Paris... In the evening we will cook something together at our place of stay, a large house in a village near Fontainebleau, and let the day fade away. Travel: We travel by bus.

The ride is far. We have to rely on detachment when driving. Who has to take the driver's card with you. Departure: Saturday 16.09.17, 07.30 Uhr Centre Sport and Sports Science (ZSSW), Bremgartenstrasse 145, 3012 Bern. Return: Saturday 23.09.17, approx. 21.00 pm, ZSSw. Any changes will be notified by e-mail. Accommodation and Catering: gite des trois Pignons, 28 rue Auvers, F-77123 noisy sur Ecole (3km Southern. Milly-La Foret). We buy between food, morning and dinner for everyone (there is a catering group every day). Please take provisions for the trip yourself.
requirements: No
registration: No longer possible to log in
price: Studierende Uni und PH: CHF 270.00 / Angestellte Uni und PH: CHF 300.00 / Übrige Ausweisbesitzende: CHF 300.00
material:
Passport/ID, driver's license, EURO (board and money). Climbing finches, chalk, Bürsteli, small carpet or an old towel to clean the shoe soles before starting. Crashpads: are organized after the registration deadline (space conditions bus) headlamp or flashlight, rain protection, something warm to wear, possibly slippers, sack knives, hygiene utensils, Ohropax, hand cream (!). Slackline, Frisbee, Hackysack etc.!!
Please take only the bare necessities, we do not have much storage space in the bus (most of the place will be claimed by Crashpads).

Sleeping bag, tent and Mätteli are not needed.

description:
We are a group of motion-enthusiastic people who combine acrobatics and dances in an innovative show to compete with a wide audience.
Since we are the Gymnaestradagruppe of the University of Bern, the main objective is to take part in the Swiss evening of Gymnaestrada. The Gymnaestrada is an international event that takes place only every 4 years and shows around 20,000 gymnasts from all over the world.
So if there is no Gymnaestrada on the program, we show our shows at company events, birthdays, weddings, opening ceremonies, Whitsun tours etc.
requirements: The training takes place as a guided club training and can only be visited by appointment. Unfortunately, the space is limited. If you are interested in uni-2-tre, please contact us using the form on our homepage.

description:
Day 1: Arrival by public transport to Binn, Fäld. Then climb to the Mittlenberghütte.
Day 2: Ascent via Hohsandjoch to Ofenhorn. Descent towards Italy to the Hut Claudio E Bruno Cai. 
Day 3: Blinnenhorn and over the Griesgletscher towards Nufenenpassstrasse. By bus and train back to Bern.

Die Moiry Hütte
befindet sich zuhinterst im Val d`Anniviers hoch über dem Lac de Moiry. Das
Gebiet bietet vielfältige Touren für jeden Geschmack.

ab 8:06, Moiry, Barrage an 11:02

description: This course provides the basics for combined tours in the high mountains. Day 1: Arrival and short ascent to the Sustlihütte sac. (1 hour) Material and knot customer, rescue technology on the glacier, walking and safety in steep firn, use of the pimples, climbing technique in ascent and descent, with and without crampons, safety technology, abseiling and draining. Day 2: Training Ridge climbing over the Chanzelgrat. Day 3: Varied application tour for grazing. Over the Stössenfirn we hike to the Grassenjoch. Afterwards short, alpine climbing (3.0-4th degree) with mountain boots through the south wall to graze. Descent over the Firnalpelifirn and the Stössensattel to the Sustlihütte. Arrival and timetable: Bern AB: 7:00 and Göschenen to 9:55; Continue with the Alpentaxi to the Sustenbrüggli. The travel costs are the responsibility of the participants. The stated costs cover the management and the organization. Accommodation costs in the Sustlihütte sac are not included in the price. These are paid in cash on the spot.
requirements: Ideal for beginners. Joy in mountain hiking, safety also in the uneven terrain, very good condition for all-day training on the glacier and Application Tour (approx. 8 hours).

description:
Tour week only for advanced and condition-strong varsity. We are in a small and agile group of 8-10 participants on the road.
Once again we are on the trail of Daniel Silver Nail and discover a wild, lonely and natural Area in the eastern Bernese Oberland. The tours are very varied. We pass through various glacier pools and off-road chambers.
The tours are described in the Topo-guide "Bernese Alps". 
Day 1: Ascent from the Rosenlaui to the Dossenhütte. The hut is like a eagle on the Dossengrat. 
Day 2: Mountain Tour over the Dossengrat to the Dossen. Crossing to the Ränfenhorn and descent over the Gauli to the Gaulihütte. We're visiting the Dakota Wing. It already protrudes several meters from the glacier.
Day 3: Long Climbing Tour (2nd degree) over the Chammligrat to the Hanging Glacier horn. Descent over the normal route to the Gaulihütte. 
Day 4: Glacier Tour over the Hubelhorn and the Hubellücke to the Lauteraarhütte.
Day 5: Secluded climbing Tour (in the 4th degree) via the ridge to the brand Lamb Horn Summit. Abseiling over the ENE spur and descent to the Bächlitalhütte.
Day 6: If we still like, we cross the Alplistock from east to west:-) (Climbing tour in the 4th degree). Then descend to the Räterichsboden and return to Bern.
requirements: Demanding high-speed tours. Only for the advanced. Experience from simple, combined high-speed tours, control of climbing on block ridges, flawless condition and absolute safety and dizziness. The rope handling and walking with crampons are practised. The tour is done in independent roped under the guidance of mountain guides. We overcome great differences in altitude in ascent and descent.

In the first three semester weeks of the autumn and spring semester, a non-binding sniff (with valid Unisport ID or UNICARD) is possible. After that, a complete participation is desired.
material: Comfortable sportswear, jazz shoes (if available) or socks.

description: In warm up and preparatory exercises, ¨ the technique, the coordination, the condition and the flexibility that serves as a basis for this style. In the concluding choreography danced to the current music of different styles, much emphasis is placed on the expression and the joy of dancing.
requirements:
No previous knowledge is required!
In the first three semester weeks of the autumn and spring semester, a non-binding sniff (with valid Unisport ID or UNICARD) is possible. After that, a complete participation is desired.

description: In warm up and preparatory exercises, ¨ the technique, the coordination, the condition and the flexibility that serves as a basis for this style. In the concluding choreography danced to the current music of different styles, much emphasis is placed on the expression and the joy of dancing.
requirements:
Little experience in jazz or VergleichbarenTanzstilen. The most important basic steps are assumed. This is where further movements (jumps, pirouettes, etc.) are built up, which are practised and danced in various combinations.
In the first three semester weeks of the autumn and spring semester, a non-binding sniff (with valid Unisport ID or UNICARD) is possible. After that, a complete participation is desired.
material: Comfortable sportswear, jazz shoes (if available) or socks.

important:
ASVZ Teilnahmeberechtigte und Berechtigte anderer Schweizer Hochschulsportorganisationen können das ganze Jahr von vergünstigten Konditionen profitieren.
 
Anmeldung direkt bei Spin Out Tarifa: www.tarifaspinout.com
 
Die Kurskosten sind abhängig von Dauer und Gruppengrösse. Während den oben erwähnten Zeiträumen haben ASVZ-Berechtigte einen Rabatt von 20% auf die unter SPIN OUT Tarifa genannten Preise.
description:
Tarifa, the southernmost tip of Europe, is the wind metropolis of the continent. In the 1980s it was discovered by Windsurfers and was conquered by kitesurfers at the end of the 20th century. The 10km long and in many places very wide beach offers enough space for beginners and experts.
 
You decide yourself in which period and how long you want to go to Tarifa.
You choose which course or training with which duration you want to book. You decide where you want to live, or how you want to move to, in and around Tarifa. You book yourself with the specified providers and can benefit from the discounts in the defined periods.
 
Gastronomy: Individual accommodation: Tarifa (southern Spain). Information about accommodation can be found under Www.asvz.ch/kitesurfen travel: individual, flight or by car (2300km from Zurich). Find cheap flights at www.swiss.ch or www.ebookers.ch. Rental cars from Malaga at PATRY at discounted rates.
 
All information can be seen here: ASVZ kitesurfing
requirements:
Students of the Swiss universities can participate.

Level: Beginners to experts, the level of courses and trainings is adapted to the participants.  The programme is adapted to the requirements and the sporting level of the participants. Prerequisite: only for swimmers.
material: In the courses, high quality and safety tested material is provided by bull, private material can be brought.

description:
Bern students can participate in the offers of the ASVZ. During the CampWoche of the ASVZ, all ASVZ eligible participants receive a 15% reduction on course prices + material of school Silvaplana. Info: www. kitesailing. ChDas offer of school Silvaplana takes place in cooperation with the ASVZ. The special prices and discounts are valid only during the ASVZ weeks and when presenting a valid LEGI/ASVZ card.
Travel, food and accommodation can be booked individually. Information at: Www.asvz.ch/kitesurfenAnmeldung: This camp is carried out by Swiss Kitesurf Silvaplana! 
Registration directly at Swiss Kitesurf Silvaplana. www.kitesailing.ch or Tel. 081 828 97 67Kursinhalt: Duration 2-5 days, theory, material science, launch, safety systems, behaviour and approach rules, flight training on land, body surfing in the water, upgrades on board.
Kitesurfing is fast and safe to learn with good introduction and training. Head: Swiss kitesurf Silvaplana Cancellation: Please note booking Regulations school Silvaplana, Engadin www.kitesailing.ch
material: In the courses wetsuit, surf shoes, trapeze are provided (private material can be brought).

important: Am 04.12.2017 wird nur an Studierende der Universität Bern und PHBern vermietet.
description:
The rental takes place in the setting Hall of ZSSw, Bremgartenstrasse 145, 3012 Berns.

The 04.12.2017 is only rented to students of the University of Bern and college.

Price: Students: CHF 130.-/Mitarbeitende: CHF 150.-For complete equipment for the whole winter, consisting of cross-country skis, Nordic boots and cross-country poles.
The return of the equipment follows only on Monday, the 16.04.03.2018 between 18.00 and 18.30 pm or on Thursday, the 19.04.2018 between 12.30 and 13.00 pm.


Rental conditions: Tenants must appear in person.
The material is to be treated carefully, any damages are reported at the University sports. Classic wax skis must be clean when dispensed and cleaned from the climbing wax. Skating and classic skis must be awakened when returning.

If the equipment is not returned on time, costs of CHF 200.00 will be charged.

If the equipment is not returned after a single reminder, we will also charge a fee of CHF 700.00.

Under the guidance of our Langlaufinstruktoren you will be introduced to the most important techniques of cross-country skiing. You'll get to know the cross-country experience using game forms and exercises. The cross-country skiing area is selected at short notice depending on snow conditions.  Meeting point: We travel either by minibus or by train to the cross-country skiing area. We will inform you about this shortly before the course by e-mail. Travel costs by train are at the expense of the participants.
requirements: None, this course is for beginners and beginners.

description:
We move in the skating and classical technique, we practice, run and enjoy the magnificent trails in the beautiful goms and relax in the hotel Alpenhof in the Oberwald. The costs include the tuition, the overnight stay including breakfast. The lunch and dinner as well as the trip and the cross-country ski pass are at the expense of the participants and are paid directly on site.


Arrival Saturday: 10.00 am meeting point in the accommodation (Exit Bern, SBB 07.06 pm, arrival 09.37 AM in Oberwald). Closing time on Sunday: 15.30 PM (Oberwald from: 16.12 am, Bern at: 18:54 pm).
requirements: None, the course is suitable for beginners and advanced skiers.
price: Studierende Uni und PH: CHF 110.00 / Angestellte Uni und PH: CHF 130.00 / Übrige Ausweisbesitzende: CHF 140.00
material:
Cross-country clothing, own cross-country skis, sticks and shoes (skating and/or classic). Rent on site is possible.


Clothes for after cross-country skiing, spare wash, toiletries, towel, possibly small backpack or waist belt for lunch/beverage on the way.

description:
In Pontresina, in the middle of the Engadine Valley, at the entrance to the Val Roseg is our base, the Holiday warehouse: Pros da God. The accommodation takes place in shared rooms (4-8 persons).


During the day we skate on the versatile and extensive network of cross-country trails, run into the roseg, roam the area on snowshoes. In the evening we have the possibility of tobogganing.



Please indicate at the registration whether the arrival is done individually or with the Unisportbus (7 places). If you would like to have a part of your luggage transported by bus, this must be delivered to the Bremgartenstrasse 145, 3012 Bern on Friday, the 20.01.17 at 16:00 pm at the House service.


Start of the race: Sunday, the 22.01.17, at 14:00 pm in the warehouse Pros da Grod, via pros da god sur 17 in Pontresina (map). The Unisport bus leaves at 09:00 pm in the ZSSw, at the Bremgartenstrasse 145, in 3012 Bern.
requirements: Minimum knowledge, 1-2 days to try out/course range.

material: Cross-country clothing (especially warm underwear), cross-country skis, sticks and shoes (rent on site is possible), wax, a sleeping bag, a kitchen cloth, a towel, play musical instruments, CDs and suit/trousers. If available: Snow shoes and telescopic sticks.

description:
Saturday: Journey with the Unisportbus to Schwarzenbühl. From there with LL-ski to the accommodation,-a hut, cross-country skiing in groups or individually and in between lunch in the hut. For the night meal is cooked together. Sunday: Breakfast, cross-country skiing, cleaning and cleaning and subsequent return to Bern. Arrival ZSSw: approx. at 17.00 am.

The price includes the management, the accommodation, the catering in the hut and the transport.

description:
We move in the skating and classical technique, we practice, run and enjoy the magnificent trails in the beautiful goms and relax in the hotel Alpenhof in the Oberwald. The costs include the tuition, the overnight stay including breakfast. The lunch and dinner as well as the trip and the cross-country ski pass are at the expense of the participants and are paid directly on site.


Arrival Saturday: 10.00 am meeting point in the accommodation (Exit Bern, SBB 07.06 pm, arrival 09.37 AM in Oberwald). Closing time on Sunday: 15.30 PM (Oberwald from: 16.12 am, Bern at: 18:54 pm).
requirements: Minimal knowledge of classical or skating technique (a course or 1-2 days to try out is sufficient). The course is not suitable for beginners.
price: Studierende Uni und PH: CHF 110.00 / Angestellte Uni und PH: CHF 130.00 / Übrige Ausweisbesitzende: CHF 140.00

Clothes for after cross-country skiing, spare wash, toiletries, towel, possibly small backpack or waist belt for lunch/beverage on the way.

description:
Friday: 17.00 am departure from ZSSw, Bremgartenstrasse 145, 3012 Bern in cross-country clothing. Drive to La Vue des Alpes, from here we walk with cross-country skis to La Sagne. After that, the accommodation and the night meal.
Saturday: Ascent towards Grand som Martel – la grande Joux – La Chaux du milieu, lunch in the restaurant (in the Chaux-du-Milieu or Cerneux-Péquignot). Continue to La Brévine or the additional loop "Le Gardot". Reference of accommodation (Dortoirs Halle Ominsport), voluntary sauna visit (CHF 16.00) and subsequent night meal. Distance: Coupierte distance of almost 25 km.
Sunday after breakfast, head towards Les Fontenettes – Le Cernil or via Bémont – Les Bouilles, lunch at the Café du Cercle in Les bayards. Continue via Les Cornées to Les Cernets. Return by Unisport Bus to Bern/arrival approx. 19.00 pm. Distance: Coupierte distance of almost 25 km.
The cost includes both overnight stays (dormitory), both breakfasts, lunches and the bus trip. Dinner is paid on the spot.

Solid cross-country skiing technique and stamina for up to 25 km, classic or skating.

description:
Content/programme: participation in the most famous ski marathon in Switzerland (42 km through the Engadine). Joint arrival and preparation for the Engadin cross-country skiing marathon. With experienced runners from other universities, last tips can be exchanged. We will stay overnight in Zuoz and on Sunday morning we will take the RHB on the journey to Maloja, where the ski marathon takes place. Joint final preparation and exchange of the last tips on the Engadin ski marathon. The price includes accommodation in a shared room and half board. Accommodation: Center da dmura per students, 7524 Zuoz, directly at the train station (www.convict.ch). Travel: Individual arrival and departure, we recommend to arrive by train. 
Detailed programme: Saturday meeting point at the Convict (www.convict.ch) in Zuoz at 12.40 accommodation: mass storage lunch-lunch (take away or shopping) in the UnterkunftAm afternoon is in St.
     Moritz briefly restarted and the starting numbers will grow AbgeholtSkis himself in the accommodation (who is interested) dinner in Convict in Zuoz Sunday by train to MalojaLanglauf from Maloja to S-ChanfRückfahrt with train from the destination area to ZuozDuschen in the  UnterkunftRückfahrt by train to St. Gallen
requirements: Ability to participate in the Engadin ski marathon. Registration for the run must be done independently.

Sleeping bag (It has no blankets in the accommodation), terry Towel, drinking bottle, sunscreen, sunglasses, two pairs of gloves (recommended for changing), two hats or headbands (recommended for changing), small backpack (for Saturday when we go to St. Moritz) and
Possibly wax material according to Waxtip Toko (if you want to grow your skis).
Cross-country skiing material: the cross-country material must be organized. The possibility for rent is at the Ruedi Sport am Loryplatz, Bern or in the cross-country centre in Zuoz (081 854 08 06). Book in advance! own equipment or rental opportunity in Zuoz. Request at registration.

Reservationen für die klassische Massage werden im Sekretariat Universitätssport telefonisch (Tel. +41 (0)31 631 47 67) oder am Schalter entgegengenommen. Terminanfragen per E-Mail können nicht verarbeitet werden.
 
Abmeldung:
Begründete Abmeldungen werden bis 24 Stunden vor dem Termin entgegen genommen. Bei kurzfristigeren Abmeldungen oder unentschuldigtem Fernbleiben wird ein Unkostenbeitrag von 50% der Gesamtkosten zuzüglich einer Bearbeitungsgebühr von CHF 20.00 in Rechnung gestellt.

Ein Pflegeprogramm für Körper, Geist und Seele schenken? Massage Gutscheine können im Sekretariat Universitätssport während den offiziellen Öffnungszeiten bezogen werden.
Massage Gutscheine können nur an Personen verschenkt werden, die eine Berechtigung haben am Programm des Universitätssports teilzunehmen.

description:
Extensive climbing weekend for experienced climbers. We climb on Saturday in the more rope lengths at the Seewenkegel. On Sunday we will take the long tour over the high Seewen ridge. Climbing level 3-5 alpin.

Bern from 6:00 towards Lucerne. Access via Altdorf and Wassen. by Postbus to Meien. Then climb to the Seewenhütte.
Return journey expected with the Alpentaxi over Wassen late.

This tour can only be carried out in favorable conditions and will be confirmed by email. In unfavourable conditions, we depart from another area.
requirements: Level 2; Experience in climbing more rope lengths and abseiling, speedy rope handling, tread safety in ascent and descent in the pathless terrain, very good condition for a ganztägie climbing tour (climbing level 3-5 alpin).

important:
Für die Teilnahme an einem Rock'n'Roll Kurs ist ein Tanzpartner
Voraussetzung. Die Teilnahme mit einem gleichgeschlechtlichen Tanzpartner ist
möglich. Es werden keine Tanzpartner/innen seitens Universitätssport
organisiert. Beide Tanzpartner müssen sich mit dem Online-Anmeldeformular für
den Rock'n'Roll Kurs einschreiben. Bitte unter Bemerkungen den Namen des
Tanzpartners/der Tanzpartnerin vermerken. Immatrikulierte Studierende und
Mitarbeitende der Universität und PH Bern können für einen Tanzpartner der
nicht an der Universität studiert oder arbeitet einen Lebenspartner-Unisportausweis
kaufen.
description: The course covers the following content: Elements of course b consolidate, vary and deepen. Small choreography in leap step technically more sophisticated partner acrobatic elements.
requirements: Mastering the elements of the basic course: Basic step Jive, lead and follow in the dance, extensive figure material, partner and role Exchange, leap step (kick) and various simple partner acrobatic elements.

description:
Touch (also known as touch rugby or touch football) is a team sport that is inspired by rugby.
 In the touch, however, there is no hard physical contact, so the risk of injury is extremely low. Touch is characterized by speed, tactics and simplicity and can be played with little effort. Since its introduction, touch has become one of the most popular wide sports in the world. This extremely attractive game sport is suitable for women as well as for men who like to play out while playing, without losing sight of tactics and fairness.

The "Backfit" is a versatile whole-body training with a focus on "back". The varied strengthening and stretching exercises support an upright and healthy posture. 
The training serves as a strengthening of the abdominal and back muscles and promotes mobility.
material: Sportswear

description: Contents: isolations, basic steps, arm, rotations, Pasitos (step Variations) and short choreographic combinations.
requirements:
There is no need for prior knowledge to participate. The course is suitable for beginners as well as for dancers with prior knowledge of deepening. The elements can be used in a salsa pair of dance classes, but the dancing training is also suitable for those interested in dancing who do not attend such a course.
In the first three semester weeks of the autumn and spring semester, a non-binding sniff (with valid Unisport ID or Unicard) is possible. After that, a complete participation is desired.
material: Comfortable sports clothing, clean (dance) shoes, ballet shoes or socks
sportOriginal: Salsa "Isolationen, Bodymovements & Pasitos"  Salsa Lady Styling B

description: The offer is dedicated to the dance movements of man and woman, conveys dancing basics such as isolation, Bodymovements and Pasitos and transposes them into solo choreographies. It is worked on the dance expression and the personal movement potential. With isolation exercises of chest, shoulders, arms, hands, hips and legs, the basis for first Afrokaribische Bodymovements is laid. These make your movements rounder, refine your dance and let the music dance even more creatively/more versatile.
requirements: Either salsa basic step or other sound dance skills a partner is not necessary, it is danced solo in the first three semester weeks of the autumn and spring semester is a non-binding sniff (with valid Unisport ID or UNICARD) Possible. After that a complete participation is desired
material: Comfortable clothes should be worn that are easy to fit and movements allow clean (dance) shoes or socks

description: Through deep-snowed forests and over-light alpine, we ascend to the Abendberg on Sundays in little steep terrain. The view opens to Lake Thun and the surrounding mountains. The descent takes place via the ascent route with small variants. Walking time at a comfortable pace 5 to 6 hours. 700 HM Ascent/700 HM descent arrival by train and bus. Between Flüh Post at 08.48 pm (Bern from 07.39 am with the Lötschberger) return from between Flüh between 15 and 4 pm. Location: From the bus stop between Flüh in the Diemtigtal on the Abendberg.
requirements: Technically, no knowledge is required, but a good physical condition is assumed. The tour will be adapted to the conditions and participants!
price: Studierende Uni und PH: CHF 45.00 / Angestellte Uni und PH: CHF 55.00 / Übrige Ausweisbesitzende: CHF 60.00
material:
Mountain boots or good trekking shoes, snowshoes, avalanche-spilled beacons, shovels, ski poles. Warm rain and wind resistant sportswear, Ev.
Leggings, small backpack, 2 pairs of gloves, cap, sun protection, thermos with hot drink, pic-Nic, snowshoes, Lawinenverschüttetengerät avalanches, shovel and telescopic ski poles can be rented at the Unisport.
The order must be made at the latest by the Wednesday before the tour until 12.00 pm in the Doodleumfrage.

description:
Through deep-snowed forests and over-light alpine, we climb up to Mont Soliat in little steep terrain. The view opens to the Creux du van and the Neuchâtel. The descent is south towards Neuchâtel to Provence. Walking time at a comfortable pace 5 to 6 hours. 700 HM Ascent/700 HM descent.
Arrival by train. Bern from 07.08 am, Noiraigue at 08.53 pm return from Provence 16.30 am Location: From the railway station Noiraigue in the Val de Travers via the Creux du van to the Mont Soliat and descent to Provence and by bus to Neuchâtel and train return to Bern.
requirements: Technically, no knowledge is required, but a good physical condition is assumed. The tour will be adapted to the conditions and participants!
price: Studierende Uni und PH: CHF 45.00 / Angestellte Uni und PH: CHF 55.00 / Übrige Ausweisbesitzende: CHF 60.00
material:
Mountain boots or good trekking shoes, snowshoes, avalanche-spilled beacons, shovels, ski poles. Warm rain and wind resistant sportswear, Ev.
Leggings, small backpack, 2 pairs of gloves, cap, sun protection, thermos with hot drink, pic-Nic, snowshoes, Lawinenverschüttetengerät avalanches, shovel and telescopic ski poles can be rented at the Unisport.
The order must be made at the latest by the Wednesday before the tour until 12.00 pm in the Doodleumfrage.

description:
Treffpunkt: Im Hallenbad
Kursinhalte: Komplexe Technikübungen in 4 Schwimmlagen, Übungen zur Verbesserung der Koordination, Training der Konditionsfaktoren.
Trainingsumfang: 2500m in 60 Min.
Die Teilnehmenden lösen ihren Hallenbadeintritt selber. Mehrfachkarten oder Abonnemente sind günstiger als Einzeleintritte, Studierende haben Vergünstigung.

description:
Meeting point: In the indoor pool course content: During 5 weeks, individual training is exercised with a swimming trainer. Whether you are a beginner, a triathlete or a fitness swimmer, the main thing is that you want to improve your swimming technique. The lessons are designed according to your wishes, you determine the content, the tempo and the intensity!

description: This evening our partners inform the sailing school H.M. S, Hari's motorboat and sailing school about the possibilities to visit the D-ticket course.
requirements: No

description:
Sailbox allows favorable sailing throughout Switzerland. The non-profit organization works like mobility car sharing: Book on the internet, yacht sailing independently; And just pay the hours you really sailed.
Sailbox uses the modern, funny and safe yacht of the type MOcean (www.mocean.ch). By using the same yacht you only need an "intro course" to sail all sailbox yachts.
The system is simple and clever. After registration, the desired sailing ship can be reserved in half-hourly blocks via the Internet or telephone.
The sailing ship is ready and tidy within 8 minutes.
Sailbox offers reduced prices for students of the University of Bern and college and releases the deposit.
More information: sailbox@sailbox.ch
requirements: • D-Ticket • Sailbox-& MOcean Intro-Course (course of 3 hours) • Sailbox-Membership

description:
With our partner, the sailing school H.M. S, Hari's motorboat and sailing school there is the possibility for an introductory sailing on the Biel.
Prior information and registration with Martin Hari, Mobile: 079 693 96 72, E-mail: info@hms-sailing.ch
requirements: Prior registration at the sailing school.
material: Clothes and shoes adapted to the weather.

important: Wer die Segelschule kennenlernen und direkte Infos beziehen möchte, empfehlen wir am Infoabend, dem 04.04.17 um 18.30 Uhr teilzunehmen.
description:
There is the possibility to either go sailing in the yacht or to make the D-ticket (lake).
The dates for the practical course are individually arranged with the sailing school. It is possible to attend daily classes of 6 hours or half-day courses of 3 hours in the morning or afternoon.
Contact and registration with Martin Hari, Mobile: 079 693 96 72, E-mail: info@hms-sailing.ch with a maximum of 3 people on the boat, the care is very individual.
The sailing instructor will be individually arranged when the exam will be completed. Price per day: Unicard/Legi (University of Bern and College): CHF 160.-/Unisportausweis: CHF 180.-This price is valid for a maximum of 5 days course.
 
If further courses are desired, the regular prices of the sailing school apply.
material: Clothes, including shoes, adapted to the weather.

description: Teilnehmeberechtigte in the Unisport can participate in the dinghies courses of the university sport of the Bernese Fachhochschule. The courses start in May, June, July and August and last 5 course evenings. Registration, payment and course administration runs directly through the Bern University of Applied Sciences. HTTPS://www.bfh.ch/service/hochschulsport_kultur/hochschulsport/biel.html
price: Studierende Uni und PH: CHF 150.00 / Angestellte Uni und PH: CHF 250.00 / Übrige Ausweisbesitzende: CHF 250.00
material: Neoprene suits, shoes and water-specific clothing can be provided. However, we kindly ask you to bring your hat and gloves, as well as enough warm clothes for after the training. For info: The facility can be used for showering.

Swiss Academic Club (SAS)

description:
Experience the special skiing and snowboarding pleasure with friends and like-minded at night skiing. The 4 km long piste is open from 18.00-8.30 pm and well lit.
Who would like to indulge in a fine cheese fondue after the ski runs at the heat in the restaurant Gypsera.
Departure with the Unisportbus from ZSSw 17.00 pm, meeting point Setting Hall ZSSw. Return approx. 22.00 am and arrival in Bern at 23.00 pm.
requirements: You can ski or snowboard safely on a blue slope.
price: Studierende Uni und PH: CHF 30.00 / Angestellte Uni und PH: CHF 30.00 / Übrige Ausweisbesitzende: CHF 30.00

important:
Im Preis sind die Übernachtung inkl. Frühstück und Abendessen und 2 Tage Unterricht mit brevetierten Skilehrer/innen inbegriffen. Die Kosten für die Mittagessen, das Liftabonnement und die Reise (Tipp: Snow’n’Rail) gehen zu Lasten der Teilnehmenden.

Bei zu geringer Teilnehmerzahl behalten wir uns vor, den Kurs kurzfristig abzusagen.
description:
Do you not want to wait for the first snowfall and to live your passion already in the autumn on the glacier in SaaS-Fee?

Therefore our tip: awaken your skis from the summer sleep and warm up in November for the start of the season. With ski instructors You experience a balanced program of teaching, coaching and free riding in the glacier Mecca SaaS-Fee. We are happy to help you with tips and tricks and make you ready for the ski season.

Arrival individually on Saturday morning, meeting point about 9 o'clock at the accommodation.

Overnight in the Hotel Glacier garden in SaaS-Fee in 4, 3 and 2-bedded rooms. The hotel is located in a prime location right in the village centre and it is only a few minutes walk to the valley station of the cable cars.

All rooms have flowing water, bedding and towels.

Two weeks before the start of the course, the detailed program will be sent by e-mail.
requirements: This course requires a medium driving ability. Liquid and safe driving with parallel ski position in medium-steep terrain (min. red pistes) is a prerequisite for this course.
registration: No longer possible to log in
price: Studierende Uni und PH: CHF 150.00 / Angestellte Uni und PH: CHF 180.00 / Übrige Ausweisbesitzende: CHF 180.00
material:
Bring your own ski equipment and ski boots, suitable ski clothing, gloves and sun or snow goggles.

The university sport does not provide its own snow sports material. However, the instructors will help you with the rent in the snow sports area with advice and deed.

Wearing a helmet is obligatory. As additional protective equipment we recommend a back tank. Please take your bathing clothes with you too. Depending on the weather and wind, it is possible that the lifts do not open, so you can at least avoid the indoor pool.

important:

Bei zu geringer Teilnehmerzahl behalten wir uns vor, den Kurs kurzfristig abzusagen.
description:
Get ready!

Start with the Unisport well prepared in the coming winter! Trained ski instructors give tips and tricks for every ski-relevant topic in time for the start of the season in the glacier Mecca SaaS-Fee. You experience a balanced program of teaching, coaching and free riding. This way, everyone can prepare themselves optimally for the new season.

Arrival individually on Saturday morning, meeting point about 9 o'clock at the accommodation.

Overnight in the Hotel Glacier garden in SaaS-Fee in 4, 3 and 2-bedded rooms. The hotel is located in a prime location right in the village centre and it is only a few minutes walk to the valley station of the cable cars.

All rooms are equipped with flowing water, bedding and towels.

Two weeks before the start of the course, the detailed program will be sent by e-mail.
requirements: Open to all performance levels! This course is especially well suited for ski beginners! Freestylers, intermediate and advanced riders are also very welcome.
registration: No longer possible to log in
price: Studierende Uni und PH: CHF 150.00 / Angestellte Uni und PH: CHF 180.00 / Übrige Ausweisbesitzende: CHF 180.00
material:
Bring your own ski equipment and ski boots, suitable ski clothing, gloves and sun or snow goggles.

The Unisport provides ski of the length 140 cm incl. bindings and poles for the beginner courses. The rent for the weekend is CHF 10.00 and is collected on the spot.

Wearing a helmet is obligatory. As additional protective equipment we recommend a back tank. Please take your bathing clothes with you too. Depending on the weather and wind, it is possible that the lifts do not open, so you can at least avoid the indoor pool.

important: Im Preis sind der Unterricht mit brevetierten Skilehrer/innen und die Reise mit dem Unisportbus inbegriffen. Die Kosten für das Mittagessen und das Liftabonnement (zwischen CHF 15.00 und CHF 55.00) gehen zu Lasten der Teilnehmenden. Es braucht mindestens 3 Anmeldungen, damit der Kurs durchgeführt wird.

The place of execution depends on the current local snow conditions.

Verschiebedatum: 21.01.2018
description:
Those who have always wanted to make a ski tour, but have not ridden a little to never off a groomed piste, will receive in this offer inputs to the driving technique in unprepared terrain. Attention, this is not a Freeridekurs. We always move in the immediate vicinity of the transport systems on slopes connecting between pieces and to the left and right of the edge of the piste. We do not make climbs with ascent aids such as snowshoes and skins. You will be accompanied by trained snow sports instructors or leaders in ski youth and sport.
 The course is aimed especially at ski touring riders who want to improve their skiing technique but also on piste riders who also want to take turns next to the piste.

The place of execution can still change and depends on the current local snow conditions. Should the snow conditions be unfavorable for a driving learning off the slopes, the postponing date will be dodged (notification by e-mail 2 days before the course).
requirements:
This course is aimed at medium to good skiers. Liquid and safe driving, in parallel skiing position, in medium-steep terrain (min. red pistes) is a prerequisite for this course.

Driving skills off the slopes are not required.
price: Studierende Uni und PH: CHF 30.00 / Angestellte Uni und PH: CHF 40.00 / Übrige Ausweisbesitzende: CHF 40.00
material: The ski equipment (touring or alpine ski) has to be brought along, an advantage is a slightly wider skis. Suitable ski clothing, gloves and sun or snow goggles. Wearing a helmet is obligatory. As additional protective equipment we recommend a back-tank, unless a backpack is worn for driving.
sportOriginal: Fahren lernen abseits der Piste Ski B

description:
Those who have always wanted to make a ski tour, but have not ridden a little to never off a groomed piste, will receive in this offer inputs to the driving technique in unprepared terrain. Attention, this is not a Freeridekurs. We always move in the immediate vicinity of the transport systems on slopes connecting between pieces and to the left and right of the edge of the piste. We do not make climbs with ascent aids such as snowshoes and skins.
You will be accompanied by trained snow sports instructors or leaders in ski youth and sport. After arrival, the luggage is first deposited in the hut. Please note that the access to the hut is only possible with ski and snowboard. A suitcase is therefore impractical to carry your luggage. There is no flowing water or electricity in the hut. Pack warm clothes, head or flashlight and make sure to take a sleeping bag with you!

description: The "Swiss University (open) championships in Nordic skiing" (SHM cross-country skiing) are held in the framework of the Swiss University Games (SWUG). All students of Swiss universities and colleges, including universities of applied sciences, are admitted to the competition in the context of SHM cross-country skiing. description:
The Swiss University Winter Games (SWUG) are held in the ski resort of SaaS fee. Teams of four persons (2 women and 2 men) compete against each other in a competition of 6 disciplines such as slalom, giant slalom, speed, photo contest etc. The aim is to welcome 40 mixed 4-university teams from all over Switzerland in SaaS-Fee.

New Professor teams are also admitted!

description:
Whether you want to jump a 180 °, switch or learn about rail slide, highly ski instructors offer individualized lessons for Freestyleanfänger and cracks on the slopes and in the park. We will be happy to coach you at your (first) Air's in the park and when learning and perfecting Freestyleelementen on the piste! The personal technology and the needs of the participants are at the centre of the business. Of course you can also pick up your lessons and make your own ski runs.

Arrival with the Unisportbus on Saturday morning approx. 7.45 pm from ZSSw. We stay in the Friends house in Grindelwald, which is a few bus from the train station. The bus stop for the Firstbahn is located directly in front of the Friends house. Duvets and bed linen are available in the accommodation. Towels must be brought by yourself.
requirements: This course is aimed at freestyle enthusiasts with a lot, little or no previous knowledge with freestyle tricks on the slopes and in the park. The course only requires safe skiing.
price: Studierende Uni und PH: CHF 120.00 / Angestellte Uni und PH: CHF 150.00 / Übrige Ausweisbesitzende: CHF 150.00
material:
Bring your own ski equipment and ski boots, suitable ski clothing, gloves and sun or snow goggles.


Driving a twin-tip ski for freestylers is advantageous and highly recommended.


The university sport does not provide its own snow sports material. However, the instructors will help you with the rent in the snow sports area with advice and deed.


Wearing a helmet is obligatory. As additional protective equipment we recommend a back tank.

With the necessary tips and tricks they teach you the basics and guarantee you the first success experiences on the snow. Arrival with the Unisportbus on Saturday morning approx. 7.45 pm from ZSSw. We stay in the Friends house in Grindelwald, which is a few bus from the train station. The bus stop for the Firstbahn is located directly in front of the Friends house. Duvets and bed linen are available in the accommodation. Towels must be brought by yourself.
requirements: This course is aimed on the part of novice skiers, beginners who have never been on the skis before or only a few days.
price: Studierende Uni und PH: CHF 120.00 / Angestellte Uni und PH: CHF 150.00 / Übrige Ausweisbesitzende: CHF 150.00
material: The Unisport provides ski of the length 140 cm incl. bindings and poles for the beginner courses. The skis are transported to the ski area with the Unisport buses and the bindings are adapted by the ski instructors to the shoe sizes. The ski hire is included in the course price of the beginner courses. Please appear in suitable ski clothing with skis, boots, gloves and sun or snow goggles. Wearing a helmet is obligatory. As additional protective equipment we recommend a back tank.

important:

description: Day 1: Arrival to Martigny. With taxi to Bourg St. Bernhard. Subsequent ascent to the Croix de Tsousse 2830m, short downhill and ascent to the Vélanhütte (2642m) approx. 1100Hm. Day 2: Ascent to the Col de la Gouille, where we will need the crampons and the skis must be worn short. Short descent and continue on Mont Vélan (3727m). Ascent 6 hours. Depending on the circumstances, the corresponding departure variant is chosen. Meeting point: Will be announced about 2 days before the tour. Return: 30 April approx. 18.30 pm in Bern.  The stated costs cover the management and the organization. The travel costs, also for cableways and taxis are the responsibility of the participants. Accommodation costs in are not included in the price and are paid in cash on the spot. Please take cash with you. Cost accommodation in Shared room Vélanhütte incl. HP: SAC members 63.-/non-SAC members 75.-. Taxi cost: CA. 40.-
requirements: Condition for ascent and departure of about 1400 altitude meters, safe and smooth skiing in unprepared snow and control of the hairpin bends. In the Col de la Gouille a short climbing point with backpack and tied skis has to be overcome.

description: Freeride without end for snowboarders and skiers! The Mountain railways transport you directly to the entrance of the spectacular downhill runs. Once there, you can enjoy the almost boundless pleasure off the slopes. The mountain guides Ervin Jacomet and David Berther ensure a safe experience. For Freerideabfahrten in unconsumed slopes, climbing with snowshoes or climbing skins is inevitable. Arrival individually on Friday morning, meeting point about 11 a.m. at the railway station in Davos. Then deposit luggage in the accommodation. Return journey Sunday, approx. 16.30 pm from Davos. All rooms are equipped with WC/shower and bed linen.
requirements: A very good driving ability off the piste, in unprepared terrain is a prerequisite for this course.
price: Studierende Uni und PH: CHF 190.00 / Angestellte Uni und PH: CHF 230.00 / Übrige Ausweisbesitzende: CHF 230.00
material:
Own snow sports material, shovel, avalanche probe, WMS (transceiver), snowshoes or climbing skins, crampons for ski touring bindings, telescopic poles, backpack to be able to mount snowboard or snowshoes, suitable clothing, Gloves, sun or snow goggles, thermos.


Avalanches, probes, shovels, snowshoes and telescopic poles can be rented at university sports.


Wearing a helmet is obligatory!

important:
Im Preis sind die Übernachtungen mit Vollpension (Mittagessen mit Lunch) und der Unterricht (auf freiwilliger Basis) mit brevetierten Schneesportlehrer/innen inbegriffen.


Die Kosten für das Liftabonnement (ca. CHF 200.00) und die Reise gehen zu Lasten der Teilnehmenden. Auf Wunsch und bei grosser Nachfrage kann eine Busreise ab Bern und zurück mit dem Unisportbus für CHF 20.00 organisiert werden.


Der Hallenbad- und Eisbahneintritt zum Multisportzentrum Palladium, zwei Gehminuten von der Jugendherberge entfernt, ist die ganze Woche gratis.

Bei zu geringer Teilnehmerzahl behalten wir uns vor, den Kurs kurzfristig abzusagen.
description:
Snowboarding, skiing, telemarking, cross-country ski and the camp experience are the main focus this week. Highly snow sports instructors offer individualised lessons at the camp at the riding level of each individual. Whether it's crack, occasional snow athlete or just not as proficient at cornering, video analysis and the tips of the snow sports instructors help to learn new movements and to improve the personal technique. It is of course also possible to practise in small groups or simply to enjoy the surroundings without a snow sports instructor and a snow sport teacher.


Meeting point on Sunday about 18.00 p.m. in the Youth hostel "Petit Baroudeur" and return trip on Friday evening about 5pm.

The Youth hostel "Le Petit Baroudeur" is exclusively available to us this week. It is located directly at the station, next to the cable car station and in the immediate vicinity of the village core. The rooms have a capacity of 4 to 10 people and the beds are equipped with pillows, Duvet and bed linen. Each room has its own sink with warm water. Showers and toilets are in the hallway. Towels must be brought by yourself. A local cook will make you feel good.
requirements: This course requires basic driving ability. Bending in simple terrain (blue piste) is the prerequisite for this course.
price: Studierende Uni und PH: CHF 420.00 / Angestellte Uni und PH: CHF 500.00 / Übrige Ausweisbesitzende: CHF 500.00
material: Bring your own snow sports material, suitable clothing, gloves and sun or snow goggles. Wearing a helmet is obligatory. As additional protective equipment we recommend a back tank.

description:
Freeride without end for snowboarders and skiers!

The Mountain railways transport you directly to the entrance of the spectacular downhill runs in the two most popular Freerideregionen in Switzerland. Once there, you can enjoy the almost boundless pleasure off the slopes.

The mountain guides Ervin Jacomet and David Berther ensure a safe experience. For Freerideabfahrten in unconsumed slopes, climbing with snowshoes or climbing skins is inevitable.

Arrival individually on Friday morning, meeting point about 9 o'clock at the train station in Andermatt. Then deposit luggage at Casa Popolo.

Depending on weather and snow conditions we stay two days in the area of Andermatt or change the area already on Saturday morning and go to Disentis.

Return journey Sunday, approx. 16.30 pm from Disentis.


Overnight stay at Casa Popolo in 2-er and 3-rooms. All rooms are equipped with WC/shower and bed linen. Towels must be brought by yourself.

The overnight stay in Disentis is in the Nangijala in 4-er and 5-rooms. Bedding is also available here.
requirements: Ein sehr gutes Fahrkönnen abseits der Piste, in unpräpariertem Gelände ist für diesen Kurs Voraussetzung.

Avalanches, probes, shovels, snowshoes and telescopic poles can be rented at university sports.

description:
Do you not want to wait for the first snowfall and to live your passion already in the autumn on the glacier in SaaS-Fee?

Therefore our tip: awaken your snowboard from the summer sleep and warm up in November for the start of the season. With our snowboard instructors You experience a balanced program of teaching, coaching and free riding in the glacier Mecca SaaS-Fee. We are happy to help you with tips and tricks and make you ready for the snowboard season.

Arrival individually on Saturday morning, meeting point approx. 09.00 am at the accommodation.

Overnight in the Hotel Glacier garden in SaaS-Fee in 4, 3 and 2-bedded rooms. The hotel is located in a prime location right in the village centre and it is only a few minutes walk to the valley station of the cable cars.

All rooms have flowing water, bedding and towels.

Two weeks before the start of the course, the detailed program will be sent by e-mail.
requirements: This course requires a medium driving ability. Liquid and safe driving in medium-steep terrain (at least red pistes) is a prerequisite for this course. Freestylers are also welcome.

The university sport does not provide its own snow sports material. However, the instructors will help you with the rent in the snow sports area with advice and deed.

Wearing a helmet is obligatory. As additional protective equipment we recommend a back tank. Please take your bathing clothes with you too. Depending on the weather and wind, it is possible that the lifts do not open, so you can at least avoid the indoor pool.

description: Those who have always wanted to do a snowboard tour, but have not ridden a little to never off a groomed piste, will receive in this offer inputs to the driving technique in unprepared terrain. Attention, this is not a Freeridekurs. We always move in the immediate vicinity of the transport systems on slopes connecting between pieces and to the left and right of the edge of the piste. We do not make climbs with ascent aids such as snowshoes and skins. You will be accompanied by trained snow sports instructors or leaders in snowboarding youth and sport. The place of execution can still change and depends on the current local snow conditions. Should the snow conditions be unfavorable for a driving learning off the slopes, the postponing date will be dodged (notification by e-mail 2 days before the course).
requirements:
This course is aimed at medium to good snowboarders. Liquid and safe driving in medium-steep terrain (at least red pistes) is a prerequisite for this course.

Driving skills off the slopes are not required.

material: The snowboard equipment has to be brought along. appropriate clothing, gloves and sun or snow goggles are required. Wearing a helmet is obligatory. As an additional protective equipment, we recommend a back tank unless a backpack is worn for driving.

Im Preis sind der Unterricht mit brevetierten Snowboardlehrer/innen und die Reise mit dem Unisportbus inbegriffen. Die Kosten für das Mittagessen und das Liftabonnement (zwischen CHF 15.00 und CHF 55.00) und ev. Materialmiete gehen zu Lasten der Teilnehmenden.


Es braucht mindestens 3 Anmeldungen, damit der Kurs durchgeführt wird.
description:
Have you ever wanted to glide down the mountain on a snowboard?


Trained snow sports instructors will accompany you on a board during your first attempts at driving. With the necessary tips and tricks they teach you the basics and guarantee you the first success experiences on the snow.


The place of execution depends on the current local snow conditions.
requirements: This course is aimed on the part of novice skiers, beginners who have never been on the snowboard before or only a few days.
price: Studierende Uni und PH: CHF 40.00 / Angestellte Uni und PH: CHF 50.00 / Übrige Ausweisbesitzende: CHF 50.00
material:
Please appear in appropriate snowboard apparel with snowboard, snowboard shoes, gloves and sun or snow goggles.


Wearing a helmet is obligatory. As additional protective equipment we recommend a back tank.

important: Im Preis sind der Unterricht mit brevetierten Snowboardlehrer/innen und die Reise mit dem Unisportbus inbegriffen. Die Kosten für das Mittagessen und das Liftabonnement (zwischen CHF 15.00 und CHF 55.00) und ev. Materialmiete gehen zu Lasten der Teilnehmenden. Es braucht mindestens 3 Anmeldungen, damit der Kurs durchgeführt wird.
description:
Get together with like-minded people on the piste and also some technique input from the snow sports instructor? Then you're right here. The personal technology and the needs of the participants are at the centre of the business.
Of course, you can also turn off lessons and make your own snowboard runs.
requirements: This course is aimed at medium and good snowboarders. Liquid and safe driving in medium-steep terrain (at least red pistes) is a prerequisite for this course.
price: Studierende Uni und PH: CHF 40.00 / Angestellte Uni und PH: CHF 50.00 / Übrige Ausweisbesitzende: CHF 50.00
material:
Bring your own ski equipment and ski boots, suitable ski clothing, gloves and sun or snow goggles. The university sport does not provide its own snow sports material. Wearing a helmet is obligatory.
As additional protective equipment we recommend a back tank.

important:
Im Preis sind 1 Übernachtung mit Halbpension, 2 Tage Unterricht mit brevetierten Snowboardlehrer/innen und die Reise mit dem Unisportbus inbegriffen. Die Kosten für Liftabo und Mittagessen, gehen zu Lasten der Teilnehmenden.


Bei zu geringer Teilnehmerzahl behalten wir uns vor, den Kurs kurzfristig abzusagen.

Verschiebedatum: 10.03.2018
description:
Those who have always wanted to do a snowboard tour, but have not ridden a little to never off a groomed piste, will receive in this offer inputs to the driving technique in unprepared terrain. Attention, this is not a Freeridekurs. We always move in the immediate vicinity of the transport systems on slopes connecting between pieces and to the left and right of the edge of the piste. We do not make climbs with ascent aids such as snowshoes and skins. You will be accompanied by trained snow sports instructors or leaders in snowboarding youth and sport.
 The place of execution can still change and depends on the current local snow conditions. Should the snow conditions be unfavorable for a driving learning off the slopes, the postponing date will be dodged (notification by e-mail 2 days before the course).
requirements: This course is aimed at medium to good snowboarders.  Liquid and safe driving in medium-steep terrain (at least red pistes) is a prerequisite for this course. Driving skills off the slopes are not required.
price: Studierende Uni und PH: CHF 30.00 / Angestellte Uni und PH: CHF 40.00 / Übrige Ausweisbesitzende: CHF 40.00
material: The snowboard equipment has to be brought along. appropriate clothing, gloves and sun or snow goggles are required. Wearing a helmet is obligatory. As an additional protective equipment, we recommend a back tank unless a backpack is worn for driving.

notes: Im Preis inbegriffen sind Unterricht, Apéro, Abendessen, Übernachtung und Frühstück.
description:
Those who have always wanted to do a snowboard tour, but have not ridden a little to never off a groomed piste, will receive in this offer inputs to the driving technique in unprepared terrain. Attention, this is not a Freeridekurs. We always move in the immediate vicinity of the transport systems on slopes connecting between pieces and to the left and right of the edge of the piste. We do not make climbs with ascent aids such as snowshoes and skins.
You will be accompanied by trained snow sports instructors or leaders in ski youth and sport. After arrival, the luggage is first deposited in the hut. Please note that the access to the hut is only possible with ski and snowboard. A suitcase is therefore impractical to carry your luggage. There is no flowing water or electricity in the hut. Pack warm clothes, head or flashlight and make sure to take a sleeping bag with you!
requirements:
Dieser Kurs richtet sich an mittlere bis gute Snowboardfahrer/innen. Flüssiges und sicheres Fahren in mittelsteilem Gelände (mind. rote Pisten) ist Voraussetzung für diesen Kurs.

Fahrkenntnisse abseits der Piste werden nicht vorausgesetzt.
price: Studierende Uni und PH: CHF 75.00 / Angestellte Uni und PH: CHF 85.00 / Übrige Ausweisbesitzende: CHF 85.00
material: The snowboard equipment has to be brought along. appropriate clothing, gloves and sun or snow goggles are required. Wearing a helmet is obligatory. As an additional protective equipment, we recommend a back tank unless a backpack is worn for driving.
sportOriginal: Fahren lernen abseits der Piste Snowboard B

important: Im Preis sind die Übernachtung mit Halbpension, 2 Tage Unterricht mit brevetierten Snowboardlehrer/innen und die Reise mit dem Unisportbus inbegriffen. Die Kosten für die Mittagessen und das Liftabonnement gehen zu Lasten der Teilnehmenden. Bei zu geringer Teilnehmerzahl behalten wir uns vor, den Kurs kurzfristig abzusagen.
notes: Dieser Kurs setzt ein gutes Fahrkönnen auf der Piste voraus. Erfahrungen im Bereich Freestyle werden nicht verlangt.
description:
Whether you want to learn a Noseturn, 360-er, backside 180 double shift, slide over a box or a backside air, highly snowboard instructors offer individualized lessons for Freestyleanfänger and cracks on the slopes and in the park. We will be happy to coach you at your (first) Air's in the park and when learning and perfecting Freestyleelementen on the piste! The personal technology and the needs of the participants are at the centre of the business. Of course, you can also turn off lessons and make your own snowboard runs. Arrival with the Unisportbus on Saturday morning approx. 7.45 pm from ZSSw.


We stay in the Friends house in Grindelwald, which is a few bus from the train station. The bus stop for the Firstbahn is located directly in front of the Friends house. Duvets and bed linen are available in the accommodation. Towels must be brought by yourself.
requirements: This course is aimed at freestyle enthusiasts with a lot, little or no previous knowledge with freestyle tricks on the slopes and in the park. The course only requires safe skiing.
price: Studierende Uni und PH: CHF 120.00 / Angestellte Uni und PH: CHF 150.00 / Übrige Ausweisbesitzende: CHF 150.00
material:
Bring your own snowboard with boots and bindings, practical snowboard clothing, gloves and sun or snow goggles.


The university sport does not provide its own snow sports material. However, the instructors will help you with the rent in the snow sports area with advice and deed.


Wearing a helmet is obligatory. As additional protective equipment we recommend a back tank.

Bei zu geringer Teilnehmerzahl behalten wir uns vor, den Kurs kurzfristig abzusagen.

We travel together on Saturday morning about 7.30 pm from ZSSw with the Unisportbus. We stay at the Hôtel L ' Escale in Le Châble. Bed linen and towels are available at the hotel.

important: Berner Studierende sowie Besitzer/innen eines Unisportausweises haben die Möglichkeit, an diesem Partnerangebot mit dem ASVZ (Hochschulsport Zürich) teilzunehmen. Der ASVZ bietet zusammen mit der Kiteschule in Silvaplana zu vergünstigten Preisen Kurse an. Dauer nach individuellem Bedürfnis und Absprache. Unicard resp. Unisportausweis unbedingt mitnehmen und der Kiteschule zeigen. Für die Anmeldung bitte die Snowkiteschule kontaktieren.
description: Group courses theory and material science launch, safety systems behavior and right of way flight training private lessons content according to personal wishes
material:
The school does not rent skis, boards or shoes. Please organize the ski or snowboard equipment on your own, preferably at home, as the course starts immediately on arrival in Silvaplana. With skis, the entry of the balance is easier, but experienced snowboarders will not have any trouble with the board either.
 
Material pool (only in combination with courses) If you book course packages, you can obtain the appropriate snowkiting for free use in the rest of the day according to the offer: kites in the appropriate sizes trapezoidal helmet

description: After a short warm-up sequence, badminton, football and basketball are played in particular.

description:
Try SUP, experience first movements!
Meeting point: Setting Hall ZSSw, Bremgartenstrasse 145, at 17:00 pm for material output. After that you can travel by bike, car or bus to the Boathouse Wohlen.
Bus connection: Bern, Newfeld p + r from 17:16 am, bus 102, Direction Bern Hauptbahnhof to Unitobler. Unitobler from 17:22 am, bus 107, direction Zollikofen Bahnhof to Hinterkappelen, Bern Street.  Then walk down to the boathouse.
registration: No longer possible to log in
price: Studierende Uni und PH: CHF 35.00 / Angestellte Uni und PH: CHF 40.00 / Übrige Ausweisbesitzende: CHF 45.00
material: Board, paddle, life vest, neoprene suit is provided by the Unisport, see also "course contents" to take with you: • Suit/trousers • Shoes that may be wet (for on-board) • Possibly dresses for on the board (shorts and T-shi RT, synthetic) • Towel • Sun protection

description: Various courses in the range B and L1. In the L1 courses we go to the Aare. The exact dates will be displayed in spring 2018.
material: Neoprene suit, life vest, board, paddle and if necessary a helmet is provided by the Unisport.

important: Für die Teilnahme an einem Standard- und Lateintanzkurs ist ein Tanzpartner Voraussetzung. Die Teilnahme mit einem gleichgeschlechtlichen Tanzpartner ist möglich. Es werden keine Tanzpartner/innen seitens Universitätssport organisiert. Beide Tanzpartner müssen sich mit dem Online-Anmeldeformular für den Standard- und Lateintanzkurs einschreiben. Bitte unter Bemerkungen den Namen des Tanzpartners/der Tanzpartnerin vermerken. Immatrikulierte Studierende und Mitarbeitende der Universität und PH Bern können für einen Tanzpartner der nicht an der Universität studiert oder arbeitet einen Lebenspartner-Unisportausweis kaufen.
description: Dancing for two is again announced! If you've always wanted to learn waltz, foxtrot, Tango, Cha Cha, samba, rumba, Jive, this is your chance now! Anyone can participate.
requirements: The basic course is suitable for anyone who still has no experience with standard and Latin dances or other dances, as well as for dancers who would like to repeat the dance steps from the ground up.
registration: No longer possible to log in
price: Studierende Uni und PH: CHF 40.00 / Angestellte Uni und PH: CHF 40.00 / Übrige Ausweisbesitzende: CHF 40.00
material: Comfortable clothes, clean dance shoes (no shoes with pencil heel!).

description:
The Step interval training is a full body workout. Here, strength, strength and stamina combined with the involvement of a stepper are improved. The endurance parts consist of a simple step-Choreo, so that step beginners are also welcome. In between, a muscle group of the global musculature is specifically trained. 
A joint warm-up to the start and a cool-down at the end complete the varied program.

The Step interval training is a full body workout. Here, strength, strength and stamina combined with the involvement of a stepper are improved. The endurance parts consist of a simple step-Choreo, so that step beginners are also welcome. In between, a muscle group of the global musculature is specifically trained. 
A joint warm-up to the start and a cool-down at the end complete the varied program.

Extension of the TAP vocabulary and improvement and refining of the technique (Pullbacks, wings, turns etc.) as well as the learning of whole, in some challenging choreographies to different musical styles.

description: KursinhaltDu get a careful introduction to Tre ®, which takes you on the path in your own "shaking process". On the first day of the course you will carry out the 7 exercises under guidance, learn the autonomous body trembling and experience how it "works". You learn to initiate, dose, regulate and end the process of trembling. By "shaking in the right measure", the tensions held in the muscles can be released in a controlled and sustainable way. On the following course days, the exercises are repeated in a shorter form and the focus is more on the shaking process itself. You gain security when you apply and experience how your "shaking process" evolves. The aim of the course is to learn how to use Tre ® independently and safely. AusblickDie exercises are primarily used to introduce your body to the process of trembling. Once your organism has learned, after a sufficient repetition of the TRE ® program, that it is easier to activate the tremors, he will not need the exercises any more. The shaking process continues to evolve with every repetition and works through your individual tension pattern from time to time. NoteTo serious health restrictions or during pregnancy is recommended for participation in TRE ® consultation with the doctor. Further information can be obtained from the training manager. http://www.atematelier.ch/
registration: No longer possible to log in
price: Studierende Uni und PH: CHF 30.00 / Angestellte Uni und PH: CHF 30.00 / Übrige Ausweisbesitzende: CHF 30.00
material: Towel

important:
Im Preis sind der Unterricht mit brevetierten Telemarklehrer/innen und die Reise mit dem Unisportbus inbegriffen. Die Kosten für das Mittagessen und das Liftabonnement gehen zu Lasten der Teilnehmenden.


Bei zu geringer Teilnehmerzahl behalten wir uns vor, den Kurs kurzfristig abzusagen.
description:
Have you always wanted to ride the slopes in Telemark style on the tracks of the ski pioneers?

Trained snow sports Instructors will guide you through your first attempts at driving. With the necessary tips and tricks they teach you the basics and guarantee you the first success experiences on the snow.


We travel back to Bern on Saturday evening and do not stay in the ski resort. On Sunday we meet again for the arrival with the Unisport bus in the ZSSw at about 7.45 pm.
requirements: This course is aimed at beginners of snow sports, novices who have never been to Telemark or just a few days.
price: Studierende Uni und PH: CHF 80.00 / Angestellte Uni und PH: CHF 100.00 / Übrige Ausweisbesitzende: CHF 100.00
material:
Please appear with appropriate Telemark equipment, gloves and sun or snow goggles.


Wearing a helmet is obligatory. As additional protective equipment we recommend a back tank.

important:
Im Preis sind der Unterricht mit brevetierten Telemarklehrer/innen und die Reise mit dem Unisportbus inbegriffen. Die Kosten für das Mittagessen und das Liftabonnement (zwischen CHF 15.00 und CHF 55.00) und ev. Materialmiete gehen zu Lasten der Teilnehmenden.


Es braucht mindestens 3 Anmeldungen, damit der Kurs durchgeführt wird.

Die Kosten für die Mittagessen und das Liftabonnement gehen zu Lasten der Teilnehmenden. Bei zu geringer Teilnehmerzahl behalten wir uns vor den Kurs kurzfristig abzusagen.
description: Together with like-minded people to celebrate the end of the season and also get some technical input from the snow sports instructor? We stay at the Hôtel L ' Escale in Le Châble. Bed linen and towels are available at the hotel.
requirements: This course is aimed at medium to good drivers. Liquid and safe driving in medium-steep terrain (at least red pistes) is a prerequisite for this course.

description: Single/single Championship for Women (WS) and Men (ms), KO tournament from Friday: Quali for MS R4/R9, WS R4/R9Ab Saturday: Ms N1/R3, WS N1/R3 on Saturday evening there is a common dinner where the new Swiss university champion and the new University master are honored. The title win gives the local university organisation the opportunity to send a tennis team to the next European University Championship in Coimbra (Portugal, 15-28 July 2018). More info
requirements: All players are enrolled at a recognised Swiss university or as a Swiss citizen at a corresponding foreign university or have completed or interrupted their studies for a maximum of 1 year.
material: Own tennis racket, tennis shoes, comfortable sportswear. Balls are provided by the organizer.
links: Als Student/in der Uni resp. PHBern ist einerseits eine Einschreibung bei Swiss Tennis, andererseits eine Meldung beim Unisport Bern (Tennisverantwortliche Priska Roth) nötig.

description:
Meetings between universities/colleges of Applied Sciences are held for three days. The tournament starts on Friday evening (18.45 pm) and ends on Sunday afternoon (15.00 pm). Three games (Single Ladies, single men and mixed) are performed at the same time per game. The exact schedule will be created upon receipt of the registrations.

Often play, exciting games, socialise with others, after-tennis and much more are the goals of the event. Each student pays a contribution of CHF 90.-. The remaining costs are paid by the university sport and the FSSU. Included in the contribution are the halls rent, balls, overnight stay (in 2/4 rooms) and board (3 meals, fondue dinner on Saturday evening; without drinks).
requirements: A team consists of 2 ladies and 2 men (preferably plus replacement 1 DM/1u). The tournament will only be sent if at least 2 ladies and 2 men report. Classification: R7

Depending on the requirements, approx. 40 to 60 km in the Toggenburg to mountainous terrain on the most beautiful routes around Bern.

important: Detailierte Infos folgen kurz vor Kursdatum. Anreisekosten zu Lasten der Teilnehmenden.
description: We will take one of the most beautiful tours in the Jura under the wheels: first it goes from Magglingenhoch to the "end of the world" and from there via Nods to the Chasseral. From the Chasseral we follow Danndem Trail on the concrete to Frinvillier – the trail is amazing and the view fantastic! The tour is about 45km long, it goes 1300 altitude meters high and 1700 altitude meters down. Meeting point: 08:13 am in the re to Biel or at 09:00 pm in front of the train station in Biel. Expected return to Bern: between 6pm and 8pm. Everyone buys their ticket themselves (don't forget the bike Day pass!)
requirements: Physically: Fit for all-day Mountain bike tour with approx. 1 ' 300 altitude meters uphill in comfortable tempo driving technique: technical skills to drive medium-heavy trails

price: Studierende Uni und PH: CHF 30.00 / Angestellte Uni und PH: CHF 40.00 / Übrige Ausweisbesitzende: CHF 40.00
material: Functional Mountain Bike: Please check the tires and brake pads before the tour and take kit for two plates. Meals: packed lunch and snacks.

important: Die Teilnehmenden lösen ihren Hallenbadeintritt selber. Mehrfachkarten oder Abonnemente sind günstiger als Einzeleintritte, Studierende haben Vergünstigung.
description:
In water fitness, many muscle groups are trained and the cardiovascular system is strained. The musculoskeletal system is not exposed to hard strokes or other undesirable loads. Each of these trainings can be promoted according to their level of performance. Water fitness is suitable for regeneration after injuries as well as holistic body training taking into account many condition factors.
 
The training takes place in the swimming pool in the standing deep water. It is reinforced by the water's re-state with and without AIDS. With running exercises the stamina is trained and the coordination is required through varied exercises. The training is completed with a Cooldown and Stretchingteil.
material: Suit or trousers and towel

important: Die Teilnehmenden lösen ihren Hallenbadeintritt selber. Mehrfachkarten oder Abonnemente sind günstiger als Einzeleintritte, Studierende haben Vergünstigung.Dieses Training fällt am 13. und 20. April und am 25. Mai 2017 aus.

description:
Salti, screws, hand...
From the 1-and 3-metre board, various jumps are learned and practised here on Tuesday and Thursday.

Beginners and beginners as well as experts and experts are welcome-personal learning goals and tempi are taken into account with individual support.

description:
The offer for students is organized by the ASVZ. The registration runs directly via the ASVZ. The hours of instruction always depend on the swell and tides. The morning session is mostly early, then there is ample breakfast, lunch session, lunch, beach volleyball, Chill @ the beach, evening session, Night meal, theory, surf DVD.

The whole thing can also take place in a different order. Daily up to 2 or even 3 surf sessions (paddling, take off, video). Every evening Therorie on topics like water and waves, weather, swell, tides, material science etc. Besides, there is plenty of time for beach volleyball and chilling and surfing DVDs...... in the Price incl.: Lessons, board, wetsuit and accommodation excl. return journey, VerpflegungVerpflegung: cooked together with the participants. (Community cash share approx. Euro. 80.--/Pers. /week). Location/accommodation: north of the French surf stronghold Biarritz. Surf is on the beach of St. Giron Plage. A modern double house with double and quadruple rooms (no sleeping bags needed!), two large living rooms, two kitchens and a terrace with barbecue facilities. The house is 200 meters away from the surf beach just behind a sand dune. Further, detailed information at: https://schalter.asvz.ch/Event/Event/Detail/37067
requirements:
Level and program for beginners who have never been in a ASVZ surf camp. The camp is suitable for good swimmers fort, without fear of the water.
Tip: As preparation the paddle training of the ASVZ will be used in the Badi Wollishofen from June. Information is available at Www.asvz.ch/paddeln
material: Surfboards and surf suits are provided.

description:
Teilnehmeberechtigte im Unisport können an den Windsurfingkursen vom 
Hochschulsport der Berner Fachhochschule teilnehmen. Die Kurse fangen 
jeweils im Mai, Juli, August und September an und dauern 5 Kursabende.

Die Anmeldung, Bezahlung und Kursadministration läuft direkt über die Berner Fachhochschule.https://www.bfh.ch/service/hochschulsport_kultur/hochschulsport/biel.html
registration: Registration, payment and course administration runs directly through the Berne University of Applied Sciences.
price: Studierende Uni und PH: CHF 150.00 / Angestellte Uni und PH: CHF 250.00 / Übrige Ausweisbesitzende: CHF 250.00

important:
Ganzjährig können ASVZ Teilnahmeberechtigte und Berechtigte anderer Schweizer Hochschulsportorganisationen von vergünstigten Konditionen profitieren.
 
Anmeldung direkt bei Spin Out Tarifa: www.tarifaspinout.com
 
Die Kurskosten sind abhängig von Dauer und Gruppengrösse. Während den oben angegebenen Zeiträumen haben ASVZ-Berechtigte einen Rabatt von 20% auf die unter SPIN OUT Tarifa genannten Preise.
description:
Tarifa, der südlichste Zipfel Europas, ist die Windmetropole des Kontinents. Sie wurde iIn den 80er Jahren von den Windsurfern entdeckt, und ist auch heute noch die windsicherste Destination in Europa. Der 10km lange und an vielen Stellen sehr breite Strand bietet genug Platz für Einsteiger und Könner.
 
Du entscheidest selbst, in welchem Zeitraum und wie lange du nach Tarifa willst. Du wählst selber, welchen Kurs oder welches Training mit welcher Dauer du buchen möchtest. Du bestimmst selber, wo du wohnen möchtest, bzw. wie du dich nach, in und um Tarifa bewegen willst. Du buchst selber bei den angegebenen Anbietern und kannst von den Vergünstigungen in den definierten Zeiträumen profitieren.
 
Verpflegung: individuell
 
Unterkunft: Tarifa (Südspanien). Informationen über Unterkünfte findest du unter www.asvz.ch/windsurfen
 
Reise: Individuell, Flug oder mit Auto (2300km ab Zürich). Günstige Flüge unter www.swiss.ch oder www.ebookers.ch zu finden. Mietautos ab Malaga bei PATRY zu vergünstigten Konditionen.
 
Alle Informationen sind hier ersichtlich: ASVZ Windsurfen
requirements:
Students of the Swiss universities can participate.
 
Beginners to experts. The level of courses and trainings is adapted to the participants. Prerequisite: only for swimmers. The programme is adapted to the requirements and the sporting level of the participants.
material: High-quality and safety-tested material is provided in the courses, and private material can be brought.

description:
In practice, various postures (asanas) are gradually being met. The breath as it comes and goes is observed. More and more mindfulness is being developed on the practice. The spirit comes to rest, and one senses the essentials.
In the meditation exercise (silence), everyone can find themselves, the source of inner strength.
